intro: Illigera rhodantha var. angustifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rhodantha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink to red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
